At Wellesley College there are
Ave students of German so intent
on studying the language that they
call their dormitory division "German Corridor," decorate their rooms
with German maps and pictures, and
speak to each other in German.
*

*

*

Oklahoma State College has an
end by the name "A. Panze."
* * *
Fraternities and sororities at the
University of Minnesota contributed approximately $1,500 to the
Minneapolis Community Chest.
*

*

*

The football team at Northwestern University has not chosen a
captain for next year. They intend
electing a captain for each game.
* * *
Will Rogers was recently selected
at Wellesley College as this year's
honorary classmate, in accordance
with an old tradition.
* *
The co-ed rifle team of the University of Oklahoma is more deadly
than the male. The markswomen
Martha Lindsly, Jewel Brookling,
Helen Stacy, Lida Barr and Reva
Clark—recently defeated the men's
squad, 493 to 393.
*
*
A former University of Oklahoma co-ed earns her livelihood
with a shining gold star, ready sixshooter, boots, and a ten-gallon hat.
She is under-sheriff in Cordella,
Oklahoma.
She received this commission,
which had formerly belonged to her
father, when the old man was attacked with a stroke of apoplexy
and died.

At Wellesley College there are
Ave students of German so intent
on studying the language that they
call their dormitory division "German Corridor," decorate their rooms
with German maps and pictures, and
speak to each other in German.
*

*

*

Oklahoma State College has an
end by the name "A. Panze."
* * *
Fraternities and sororities at the
University of Minnesota contributed approximately $1,500 to the
Minneapolis Community Chest.
*

*

*

The football team at Northwestern University has not chosen a
captain for next year. They intend
electing a captain for each game.
* * *
Will Rogers was recently selected
at Wellesley College as this year's
honorary classmate, in accordance
with an old tradition.
* *
The co-ed rifle team of the University of Oklahoma is more deadly
than the male. The markswomen
Martha Lindsly, Jewel Brookling,
Helen Stacy, Lida Barr and Reva
Clark—recently defeated the men's
squad, 493 to 393.
*
*
A former University of Oklahoma co-ed earns her livelihood
with a shining gold star, ready sixshooter, boots, and a ten-gallon hat.
She is under-sheriff in Cordella,
Oklahoma.
She received this commission,
which had formerly belonged to her
father, when the old man was attacked with a stroke of apoplexy
and died.
